name: couscous with vegetables
ingredients: 3 liters of water (1 liter for moistening the semolina and 2 liters for the broth)

Vegetable broth: 800 g of turnips, 600 g of zucchini, 1 kg of pumpkin, 450 g of green cabbage, 160 g of chickpeas (cooked), 600 g of eggplants, 200 g of carrots, Tomatoes, onions, parsley, coriander (in a bouquet garni), Ground ginger, Turmeric, Ras el Hanout
steps: Prepare the semolina: Fluff the couscous. Moisten with salted water, let it rest. Fluff again, add olive oil. Place in the top of the couscoussier (15 minutes of steaming). Repeat the process 3 times.

Prepare the broth: Chop the onions and tomatoes. In the bottom part of the couscoussier, heat the olive oil. Add the spices, onions, and fresh tomatoes. Add vegetable trimmings (if used). Let it simmer.
Add the chickpeas (soaked and cooked separately or canned) and the vegetables that take the longest to cook (turnips, carrots). Add water. Let it simmer.
Add the cabbage, zucchini, and pumpkin (these can also be cooked separately in a bit of broth). Let the vegetables cook.
Finishing: Heat the vegetables and chickpeas in the broth. Pour the couscous into a deep dish. Incorporate the butter in pieces. Roll the semolina to coat it well.
Arrange in a dome shape, with the vegetables around and the broth served separately.
